Was ist der Output des folgenden Codes? let x = 1+1 console.log(x) Copy 1 0 Submit
To follow along with this lecture you need python pandas the Dataset we are going to use: vgsales.csv info Please download the Dataset and follow along as you read this lecture
Dataframes in pandas are basically just tables. The most common way to create a Dataframe is by reading a csv file df = pd.read_csv('data.csv') Copy

To get a sense of what our Dataset looks like we can take a lot at the first rows with df.head() # returns the first 5 rows (5 is default) df.head() # You can also pass in the desired amount of rows # returns the first 10 rows df.head(10) Copy

If we are only interested in some of the columns we can select them as follows # select a single column genres = vgs['Genre'] publishers = vgs['Publisher'] # select multiple columns genres_and_publishers = vgs[['Genre', 'Publisher']] years_and_sales = vgs[['Year', 'Global_Sales']] # select rows based on condition games_from_2008 = vgs[vgs.Year == 2008] racing_games = vgs[vgs.Genre == 'Racing'] Copy info If you are unsure about the exact spelling of a column then you can always check the column names with print(df.columns) or print(list(df))

We can select a subset of rows if we pass in a boolean. If we want to chain multiple booleans together we have to use the bitwise operators &, |, ~, ^ instead of and, or, not # Select all Wii games wii_games = vgs[vgs.Platform == 'Wii'] # Select all Wii racing games wii_racing_games = vgs[(vgs.Platform == 'Wii') & (vgs.Genre == 'Racing')] Copy info You can also select Columns with the "dot Notation" E.g vgs.Name and vgs["Name"] are both equivalent.

If we want to select a subset of both rows and columns we could just chain the row and column selectors together # Select Publishers of Puzzle Games puzzle_publishers = vgs[vgs.Genre == 'Puzzle']['Publisher'] # Select Names of Playstation 2 Games ps2game_names = vgs[vgs.Platform == 'PS2']['Name'] Copy danger Do not do this because it can lead to chained assignments. Use DataFrame.loc instead If we use vgs.loc[<rowsSelector>, <columnsSelector>] our code would look like this # Select Publishers of Puzzle Games puzzle_publishers = vgs.loc[vgs.Genre == 'Puzzle', 'Publisher'] # Select Names of Playstation 2 Games ps2game_names = vgs.loc[vgs.Platform == 'PS2', 'Name'] Copy

Series.unique# # list all unique Publishers vgs['Publisher'].unique() # list all unique Genres vgs['Genre'].unique() Copy Series.value_counts# # Number of Games per Year vgs['Year'].value_counts() # Number of Games for each Genre vgs['Genre'].value_counts() Copy DataFrame.idxmax# # Year with the most Games vgs['Year'].value_counts().idxmax() Copy DataFrame.nlargest# # Select the 5 Publishers who have released the most games vgs['Publisher']value_counts().nlargest(5) # Select the 3 Years with most video games released vgs['Year']value_counts().nlargest(3) Copy
For more complex relations we can group the DataFrame by one or more columns. Copy

0) Find out which game has the greatest number of Platforms it was released on name = vgs.groupby('Name')['Platform'].nunique().idxmax() print(name) vgs.loc[vgs.Name == name, 'Platform'].unique() Copy 1.) Select the 5 most freqeuent Genres for the Publisher Nintendo nintendo = vgs.loc[vgs.Publisher == 'Nintendo', 'Genre'].value_counts().nlargest(5) Copy 2.) Select the 10 Publishers with the most unique games published vgs.groupby('Publisher')['Name'].nunique().nlargest(10) Copy 3.) Rank all Publishers by their total Global_Sales ranked = vgs.groupby('Publisher')['Global_Sales'].sum().sort_values(ascending=False) Copy
You can provide a downloadable resource by using DownloadButton or DownloadLink

import {DownloadLink} from '@theme/Download'; The DownloadLink <DownloadLink path="/datasets/vgsales.csv" text="does not"/> break the text flow. Copy The DownloadLink does not break the text flow. danger The path root is in /static and has to start with a backslash. datasets/vgsales.csv or ./datasets/vgslaes.csv will not be accepted!

Optional Arguments are text : the text inside the link or button name : the name of the downloaded file import {DownloadButton} from '@theme/Download'; <DownloadButton path="/datasets/vgsales.csv" text="example dataset" name="dataset.csv"/> Copy example dataset info if you provide a name you have to include the file extension

let x = 1+1 function increment(n){ return n+1 } Copy x = 1+1 def increment(n): return n+1 Copy note if no language is specified in markdown or the language is not supported the codeblock renders as usual x = 1+1 def increment(n): return n+1 Copy
a new language specific color can be added with just two css rules .prism-code.language-css{--language-color: pink} .prism-code.language-css::after{content: "css"} Copy

Hier ist ein bisschen text um zu sehen wie sich die margin der Quiz-Komponente aussieht note shosh Was ist der Output des folgenden Codes? let x = 1+1 console.log(x) Copy 1 0 Submit Kann man auch ein multiple choice quiz ohne code block erstellen? let x = 1+1 console.log(x) Copy Ja indem man einfach die Felder 'code' und 'codeLang' weglässt Nein Submit Hier ist ein bisschen text um zu sehen wie sich die margin der Quiz-Komponente aussieht
